abstract: Australian regulators are taking Google to court about how it describes ads on search results and whether some of those ads are misleading. This raises interesting questions but leaves out an important issue for Yahoo: paid inclusion.
snippet: Australian regulators are taking Google to court about how it describes ads on search results and whether some of those ads are misleading. This raises interesting questions but leaves out an important issue for Yahoo: paid inclusion.
lead_paragraph: Consumer regulators in Australia are taking Google to court claiming it is not properly disclosing the difference between its organic search results and its advertising.

abstract: Sergey Brin, sitting atop the Zeitgeist at Google, is hardly a press hound. But as one of the people of the moment, he was willing to show a little leg on the way out of Thursday morning’s conferences.
lead_paragraph: Sergey Brin, sitting atop the Zeitgeist at Google, is hardly a press hound. But as one of the people of the moment, he was willing to show a little leg on the way out of Thursday morning’s conferences.

headline.main: Sun Valley: Google and the Facebook Question

abstract: DoubleClick employees skip pizza and walk down the back staircase to sample organic pear tarts and chicken Tikka in Google’s famed cafeteria.
snippet: DoubleClick employees skip pizza and walk down the back staircase to sample organic pear tarts and chicken Tikka in Google’s famed cafeteria.
lead_paragraph: Since Google agreed to acquire DoubleClick for $3.1 billion, the online advertising giant has begun introducing DoubleClick employees to the Google way of life.

headline.main: DoubleClick Employees Worry About Gaining the “Google 15″
